intro: Montolivaea bequaertii, commonly known as the Socotra starfish, is a unique succulent native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that resemble the arms of a starfish. The plant is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat, with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the rainy season, adding a striking contrast to its green foliage. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
